Observational Astronomy: The study of celestial objects by observing them with telescopes across the electromagnetic spectrum (e.g., optical, radio, x-ray).
Theoretical & Computational Astrophysics: The use of physical models and computer simulations to understand celestial phenomena, from stars to galaxies.
Cosmology & General Relativity: The study of the origin, evolution, and large-scale structure of the universe, including dark matter and dark energy.
